Package enigma

Class RotorGroup

java.lang.Object
enigma.RotorGroup
public class RotorGroup
extends java.lang.Object
A class representing a group of rotor objects

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    RotorGroup​(Rotor[] rotors)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void advance()
    advance the left rotor by one.
    int[] getChildRotorSettings()
    Returns array of settings of all the rotors in this enigma.RotorGroup object.
    int getPosition​(int pos)
    Returns the position which forms a circuit on the leftmost end for a given position on the rightmost end
    int getPositionInverse​(int pos)
    Returns the position which forms a circuit on the rightmost end for a given position on the leftmost end.
    static RotorGroup getRotorGroupByNames​(java.lang.String[] rotorNames, int[] rotorSettings)
    Useful for creating a enigma.RotorGroup object, given the names of each rotor and their corresponding settings (these rotor names must be available in WiringInfo class)
    void setChildRotorSettings​(int[] settings)
    Sets the settings of all the rotors in this enigma.RotorGroup object.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • RotorGroup

      public RotorGroup​(Rotor[] rotors)
      Parameters:
      rotors - An array of enigma.Rotor objects that need to be a part of this enigma.RotorGroup

  • Method Details

    • getPosition

      public int getPosition​(int pos)
      Returns the position which forms a circuit on the leftmost end for a given position on the rightmost end
      Parameters:
      pos - given position on the rightmost end
      Returns:
      the position which forms a circuit on the leftmost end for a given position on the rightmost end

    • getPositionInverse

      public int getPositionInverse​(int pos)
      Returns the position which forms a circuit on the rightmost end for a given position on the leftmost end.
      Parameters:
      pos - given position on the leftmost end
      Returns:
      the position which forms a circuit on the rightmost end for a given position on the leftmost end.

    • advance

      public void advance()
      advance the left rotor by one. if required, advance rotors to the right as well

    • getRotorGroupByNames

      public static RotorGroup getRotorGroupByNames​(java.lang.String[] rotorNames, int[] rotorSettings)
      Useful for creating a enigma.RotorGroup object, given the names of each rotor and their corresponding settings (these rotor names must be available in WiringInfo class)
      Parameters:
      rotorNames - The list of names of the required rotors.
      rotorSettings - The initial settings for each of the required rotors.
      Returns:
      The newly prepared enigma.RotorGroup object.

    • getChildRotorSettings

      public int[] getChildRotorSettings()
      Returns array of settings of all the rotors in this enigma.RotorGroup object.
      Returns:
      the array of settings of all the rotors in this enigma.RotorGroup object.

    • setChildRotorSettings

      public void setChildRotorSettings​(int[] settings)
      Sets the settings of all the rotors in this enigma.RotorGroup object.
      Parameters:
      settings - the array of new settings for all the rotors in this enigma.RotorGroup object.
